Benjamin Tse

Engineer Maker Innovator

More about me

Hi, I am Benjamin. Lightshade is my nickname.

I am a passionate engineer with a focus on innovation and the development of robotic solutions. I believe that technological advancement will improve our standards of living while reducing the monotonous and dangerous work people do.

My goal is to be an innovator who can combine design and engineering with business and customer needs to provide solutions that can create a significant impact on peopleâ€™s lives.

Outside of work, I spend my time making and tinkering on my little projects such as the kinetic drizzle and canard Y4 RC aircraft. I also enjoy learning new skills online which could be useful to me in the future.

I've worked at...

NUS | Research Engineer

Feb 2023 - Current

I work on some cool sensors and HOPES, a tonometry device that isn't uncomfortable to use.

Avetics Global | Mechanical Engineer

Mar 2021 - Feb 2023

Did the mechanical design of Vline drone tethers and the Lumicopter.

Flytrex | Field Engineer

Jan 2019 - July 2019

Had the opportunity to intern at one of the world's leading drone delivery startups and it was truly an eye-opening experience.

Flytrex | Field Engineer

My Projects

Kinetic Drizzle

Imagine a mini kinetic rain on your desktop!
Canard Y4 VTOL aircraft

The craziest RC model aircraft that I could think of... and make.
Canard Rotor Wing

In my final year in NUS, I built a mock up of an electric canard rotor wing to test its feasibility.
Triturn - Innoventure

My friends and I came up with an idea to help nurses with maneuvering paitents. Managed to get to the finals of the hackathon.
